properties.title: Lotus Domino iNotes exporter: POP3, mbox & maildir

release.action: [mailbox] exports can now write to gzip-compressed files, saving disk space
can now display iNotes quota information ("quota" command)
[pop3] login can now be user@domain.example@https://webmail.example.com in addition to user@https://webmail.example.com
[pop3] fix a slow memory leak where a very small % of client sockets block on reading despite being closed
[pop3] POP3 server will now listen on a SSL/TLS port for an encrypted communication channel (POP3S)
[pop3] implement the "TOP n" command for n > 0. You can now read your mails with the iPhone MUA! :-)
[pop3] POP3 server will now temporarily ban user names and client IPs on authentication failures
[pop3] add support for rfc3206
[mailbox][maildir] exports can now have an upper bound (in addition to the lower bound) date, and can optionally delete exported messages from the iNotes server
[mailbox] add support for the MMDF format
[maildir] add support for the MH format
greatly improve metadata parsing speed (XPath -> StAX)
compress HTTP requests, speeding up network communications
update SLF4J to version 1.7 to enable (simple) file logging. This means some syntax change in simplelogger.properties; beware if upgrading!
fix incorrect Date: MIME header (sent by no other than Lotus Notes!), that are incorrectly parsed by some email agents
[maildir++] fix incorrect nested folders name
[maildir][maildir++] exports where always full instead of incremental
[maildir] give a meaningful error message (instead of a NPE) when the user gives an incorrect folder id
[pop3] give a meaningful error message when the user gives an incorrect webmail url at login
MailDir++ export
allow to override iNotes.properties properties on the command line (-Dkey=value)
fix lost HTTP session when the iNotes.properties's server URL ends with a /
[export] ensure last export date is correctly set to last exported message in case of error
[pop3] don't load messages meta-data on QUOTA or PASS (speed up pop3 login)
[pop3] merge FOLDERS and FOLDER commands
initial internal configuration re-work
ability to list iNotes (IMAP) folders and their uid (command-line and POP3 commands)
[pop3] new command: logger, to set SimpleLogger levels at runtime
[pop3] remove remaining singleton, impacting multi-user capability

[export] the same (OS) user can now incrementally export multiple (iNotes) users mailboxes, and have iNotes Exporter correctly track the last export date for each one (previously the export date did not track folder name)

[export] the same (OS) user can now incrementally export multiple (iNotes) users mailboxes, and have iNotes Exporter correctly track the last export date for each one (previously there was only 1, shared, export date)
FreeBSD init.d scripts

Non-Oracle JVMs <= 6 (i.e. OpenJDK 6) do not implement java.net.CookieManager correctly (and anyway, having a JVM singleton (CookieHandler#setDefault(java.net.CookieHandler)) for cookies management sucks!). Manually manage cookies so that iNotes-exporter can run on all JVMs.
[maildir] new export format: MailDir
[pop3] new command: QUOTA
[pop3] login greeting message now warn when user is reaching its quota
[pop3] pop3 server is now multi-threaded (and thus multi-user)
[mbox] exporter now warn when user is reaching its quota
[mbox] lock output file to prevent concurrent access by other applications
jar file is now runnable: try java -jar iNotes-exporter-1.1-jar-with-dependencies.jar
[mbox] incremental export is now more intelligent, and stores the last export date to automatically continue on existing output file: no need to specify the export start date anymore!
[mbox] out file will be appended in case of partial export (i.e. when specifying a start date)
[mbox] tweak the export optional start date to include hour and minute
[mbox] add iNotes meta-data as X-iNotes- MIME headers
[mbox] only open the output file once logged in and meta retrieved
[pop3] add iNotes meta-data as X-iNotes- MIME headers
[pop3] handle client socket disconnection gracefully
more detailed logs (trace level) in case of need
misc small fixes and improvements
[pop3] pop3 server
[mbox] incremental exports
[maven] allow to build an uber-jar
performance updates (use streaming API)
[mbox] misc fixes (maven build, iNotes preferences leading to different default urls, paging for >1000 emails)
